---
title: "View and filter model findings"
date: last-modified
---

Access a complete list of filterable findings logged across all your models in the {{< var validmind.platform >}}, or look at only findings linked to a specific model.

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] The model is already registered in the model inventory.[^1]
- [x] Model documentation is completed or in progress for your model.[^2]
- [x] You are a [{{< fa circle-check >}} Validator]{.bubble} or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^3] 

:::

## View model findings

You can review findings for all models at once, or only look at findings linked to a specific model.

#### All model findings

To view findings for all models: 

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Model Findings**.

   In the page that opens is a list of all model findings, including information for:

   - Title
   - Severity
   - Status
   - Inventory model
   - Risk area
   - Assignee
   - Due date
   - Creation date

   ![List of findings across all models](all-model-findings.png){fig-alt="A screenshot showing a list of findings across all models" .screenshot .lightbox}

::: {.callout title="Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users."}
Filter this list to include only findings you want to see,[^4] or toggle visibilty for column headers that can be dragged and dropped to change the order.[^5]

:::

2. Click on any model finding for more information, including the proposed remediation plan and any supporting attachments.[^6]

   Attachments are listed with the following information:

   - Filename
   - The user who uploaded the file
   - File size

   Click on the attachment to view or download the file. 

#### Model-specific findings

To view findings linked to a specific model:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} **.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^7]

3. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Model Findings**.

   In the page that opens is a list of findings associated with that particular model, including information for:

   - Title
   - Description
   - Severity by color
   - Status
   - Assignee
   - Due date

   ![List of findings specific to a model](model-specific-findings.png){fig-alt="A screenshot showing a list of findings specific to a model" .screenshot .lightbox}

4. Click on any model finding for more information, including the proposed remediation plan and any supporting attachments.[^8]

   Attachments are listed with the following information:

   - Filename
   - The user who uploaded the file
   - File size

   Click on the attachment to view or download the file. 


## Filter and sort model findings

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

- By default, model findings for all models are listed by creation date in descending order.
- To sort findings by a column in ascending ({{< fa angle-down >}}) or descending ({{< fa angle-up >}}) order, click on the column header.

To narrow down the findings, you can apply some filters:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Model Findings** for the list of all model findings.

2. Click **{{< fa filter >}} Filter**.

3. On the **Select Your Filters** dialog that opens, enter your filtering criteria for:

   - Status
   - Model inventory
   - Risk area
   - Business units
   - Severity
   - Assignee

   For example, to filter by open findings for the `Customer Churn Model` assigned to `Jane Doe`:

   ![Filter dialog with some options selected](filter.png){fig-alt="A screenshot of the filter dialog with some options selected" .screenshot}

4. Click **Apply Filters**.

Filters can be removed by clicking on the {{< fa xmark >}} next to them on the main **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Model Findings** page where the results are displayed. 

## Customize model findings layout

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

Customize what is displayed on your list of all model findings:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Model Findings** for the list of all model findings.

2. Click **{{< fa table >}} Manage Columns** to manage column visibility and order.

   You can toggle visibility for each item and drag each option to change the order.

Once customized, you can save a view for later application.

### Manage custom findings views

:::{.callout}
Saved views are unique to you and do not display for other users in your organization.
:::


### Save new view findings view

You can save custom findings configuration as a view to reapply at any time:

1. Customize a findings layout.[^9]

   You can also apply filters or sorting before saving your view.[^10]
